title: Newcastle 1-1 Norwich: Eddie Howe gets first-hand taste of what to expect on Tyneside
description: Newcastle are winless in seven games since being taken over and Eddie Howe is learning quickly that his task on Tyneside will be a tough one.

title: 25 years of passion and dedication - the making of Lionesses’ history maker White
description: A player so good as a youngster that her dad tried to bet on her becoming an England international - the story of Ellen White, the Lionesses' record goalscorer.

title: Covid: Are Christmas parties being cancelled over Omicron?
description: Restaurateurs say they are worried Christmas parties will not go ahead this year over Covid fears.

title: Why US abortion laws could be changed by Supreme Court ruling
description: If Roe v Wade is overturned, millions of American women will lose access to legal abortions.

title: Norwich retailers, shoppers and commuters on mask-wearing
description: The reintroduction of mandatory face coverings on public transport and in shops comes into force.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Nurse tells of desperate bid to save girl
description: Bethany Crook describes seeing eight-year-old Manchester attack victim Saffie-Rose Roussos "slip away".

title: Covid: We'll throw everything at booster campaign, says PM
description: Boris Johnson says there needs to be "another great surge" against coronavirus and the new variant.

title: Global markets fall after Moderna Omicron warning
description: Stock markets slide after Moderna boss casts doubt on vaccine effectiveness against new variant.

title: Barry Bennell: Paedophile coach denies abusing boys while Man City scout
description: Paedophile Barry Bennell says he was not linked to City at the time eight men say he abused them.

title: Man rescued after 22 hours adrift off Japan coast
description: Watch the moment rescuers reach the 69-year-old, whose boat capsized in stormy waters.

title: Covid: Omicron variant in Netherlands earlier than thought
description: The new Covid-19 variant is found in Dutch samples taken before it was reported by South Africa.

title: UK competition watchdog orders Meta to sell Giphy
description: The CMA rules Facebook's purchase of the vast Gif database unfair to competing social-media platforms.

title: TSB to close another 70 branches by July
description: The bank had 475 branches just over a year ago, but a fresh round of closures will leave it with 220.

title: Storm Arwen: Northern Powergrid criticised over continued cuts
description: About 20,000 households had a fourth night without power and say getting information is difficult.

title: FA Cup-winning Coventry manager Sillett dies
description: Former Coventry City manager John Sillett, who guided the club to FA Cup success in 1987, has died aged 85.

title: MI6 boss warns of China 'debt traps and data traps'
description: Richard Moore also denies the fall of Kabul was an intelligence failure in a BBC Radio 4 interview.

title: Fifth Ashes Test in Perth in doubt over Covid-19 rules
description: There is doubt over whether the fifth Ashes Test will take place in Perth because of Covid-19 restrictions.

title: 'Absolute disrespect' - Ronaldo disputes Ballon d'Or 'lies' about outdoing Messi
description: Cristiano Ronaldo accuses the France Football editor of lying after he said the Portuguese's only ambition was to retire with more Ballons d'Or than Lionel Messi.

title: Mandatory masks: 'We worry people won't shop with us'
description: Shopkeepers are concerned about enforcing mask-wearing and fear they will have to close again.

title: Barbados: Rihanna made national hero as island becomes republic
description: The artist and businesswoman is honoured at an event marking the nation's status as a republic.

title: Actor Mark Bonnar revisits his dad's famous concrete hippos
description: The sculptures were among artworks created by Stan Bonnar for Scotland's new towns in the 1970s.

title: Newspaper headlines: Booster jabs 'scramble' and Maxwell goes on trial
description: The front pages focus on the expansion of the booster rollout and the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Jack Dorsey: What's next for Twitter's co-founder?
description: The last time the tech visionary left Twitter, he set up another company now worth $100bn.

title: Why broken African phones are shipped to Europe
description: A lack of recycling facilities in Africa has spurred one Dutch company to import broken phones.

title: Yemen: The children haunted by 'ghosts' of war
description: BBC Middle East editor Jeremy Bowen meets terrified families running from civil war in Yemen.

title: Why France is declaring Josephine Baker a national hero
description: Josephine Baker is the first black woman to be remembered in the resting place of France’s national heroes.

title: Covid: 'We’ve had 20 cancellations in one weekend'
description: As worries emerge over a new Covid variant, hospitality fears it could thwart the busiest time of year.

title: Is the British media Islamophobic?
description: Wajed Iqbal won damages of £180k after the Mail on Sunday falsely linked him to a grooming gang.

title: Sacchi's 'immortal' AC Milan and their brush with death in Belgrade
description: In November 1988, AC Milan travelled to Belgrade for a European Cup tie that would see one of their team-mates needing on-pitch resuscitation.
